thread.title: Eastern beats Haddonfield on McElroy's golden goal
thread.title_full: Eastern beats Haddonfield on McElroy's golden goal

title: Eastern beats Haddonfield on McElroy's golden goal
text:
More coverage: Southeastern Pa. high school sports The title game is Oct. 31 at Paul VI.
McElroy scored with 4 minutes, 13 seconds remaining in the first overtime on a header off a mad scramble in front of the Haddonfield goal. 
The play began with a long throw-in by Jordan Brandt. 
Eastern's Dan Lim flicked the ball toward the net, and Zach Goldberg got a foot on the ball as well. 
The ball came loose in the air and McElroy was there to head it home and pop the cork on a wild celebration for the Vikings. 
"I just ran in the corner and everybody started jumping on top of me," McElroy said of the dog-pile that included the entire Eastern team. "It was getting tight in there. I think the biggest guy on the team jumped on top at the end." 
Haddonfield goalie Jon Baxter was injured on the play and stayed on the turf for several minutes after the game. 
In a good show of sportsmanship, McElroy approached Baxter on the Haddonfield bench after the game to check on him. 
McElroy, a defender, said the Vikings' defense was the key to the victory. 
Eastern withstood several flurries of pressure from Haddonfield. 
Haddonfield, the No. 4 seed, (16-1-1) did the same against Eastern's pressure. 
"The overwhelming take-away for me is pride in my guys," Haddonfield coach Ryan Nixon said. "That (Eastern) is one of the best Group 4 teams in this end of the state and it was dead-even. 
"We had chances. They had chances. It could have gone either way. 
"If I know my guys, this could be the catalyst to a great run (in the state tournament)." 
Haddonfield broke to a 1-0 lead on a great goal by sophomore Jack Dugan, who showed poise in traffic before burying a blast a little over five minutes into the game. 
Eastern tied the score at 1-1 with 4:27 left before halftime when Diego Valle converted a cross from Tanner Koch. 
Eastern 1 0 1 - 2 
Haddonfield 1 0 0 - 1 
Goals: E-Diego Valle, Tom McElroy; H-Jack Dugan. 
Saves: E-Gabe Sable, 6; H-Jon Baxter, 7.
